Package org.neo4j.consistency.checking.cache

Interface CacheAccess

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCacheAccess
    public interface CacheAccess
    Just as RecordAccess is the main access point for AbstractBaseRecord and friends, so is CacheAccess the main access point for cached values related to records, most often caching parts of records, specific to certain stages of the consistency check. The access patterns to CacheAccess is designed to have multiple threads concurrently, and so client() provides a CacheAccess.Client that accesses the cache on the current thread's behalf. The cache is a compact representation of records, tied to an id, for example nodeId. There can be multiple cached values per id, selected by slot.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static interface  CacheAccess.Client
      Client per thread for accessing cache and counts for statistics

    • Field Detail

      • EMPTY_CLIENT

        static final CacheAccess.Client EMPTY_CLIENT

      • EMPTY

        static final CacheAccess EMPTY

    • Method Detail

      • client

        CacheAccess.Client client()
        Returns:
        CacheAccess.Client for the current Thread.

      • isForward

        boolean isForward()
        A flag for record checkers using this cache, where cached values are treated differently if we're scanning through a store forwards or backwards.
        Returns:
        true if the scanning is currently set to go forward.

      • setForward

        void setForward​(boolean forward)
        Tells this CacheAccess whether or not the current stage, i.e is scanning forwards or backwards through a store or not. The cached values are treated differently depending on which. This is due to the double-linked nature of some stores, specifically the relationship store.
        Parameters:
        forward - true if the current scanning is forwards, otherwise it's backwards.

      • clearCache

        void clearCache()
        Clears all cached values.

      • setCacheSlotSizes

        void setCacheSlotSizes​(int... slotSize)
        Sets the slot sizes of the cached values.
        Parameters:
        slotSize - defines how many and how big the slots are for cached values that are put after this call.

      • setCacheSlotSizesAndClear

        void setCacheSlotSizesAndClear​(int... slotSize)
        Sets the slot sizes of the cached values. Also clears the cache.
        Parameters:
        slotSize - defines how many and how big the slots are for cached values that are put after this call.

      • setPivotId

        void setPivotId​(long pivotId)
        Sets the node id that is 0, such that all cache interactions uses this pivot node id to calculate the actual node id. This is because the node id is used as index into the cache and the cache may be used to run multiple iterations over a store, where only parts of the store is checked.

      • prepareForProcessingOfSingleStore

        void prepareForProcessingOfSingleStore​(long recordsPerCPU)
